meanings.definition: A person in charge of a railroad yard.
meanings.sent1: The yardmaster ensured all the trains were in the right place.
meanings.sent2: The yardmaster's job is to oversee the operations in the railroad yard.
meanings.sent3: The yardmaster joked that they had to be a 'train whisperer' to do their job.
meanings.sent4: She was the yardmaster of her own little kingdom of tracks and trains.
meanings.sent5: The yardmaster's whistle echoed through the yard, signaling the start of the day.

meanings.definition: To supervise or manage a railroad yard.
meanings.sent1: He would yardmaster the yard efficiently, making sure everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent2: She yardmastered the yard with precision and expertise.
meanings.sent3: The yardmastered yard was a well-oiled machine under his watchful eye.
meanings.sent4: They yardmastered the chaos of the yard into organized efficiency.
meanings.sent5: Yardmastering the yard required attention to detail and quick decision-making skills.
